comments.body: we didn't actually drop anything under `vendor/github.com/go-openapi/spec` as part of this, so we actually increased our dependencies... what is requiring `github.com/go-openapi/spec` now?

@liggitt this is what I shared in Slack:

`github.com/go-openapi/spec` is still being pulled in by `kustomize` though (but k/k doesn't depend on it anymore).

```console
$ go mod why github.com/go-openapi/spec
# github.com/go-openapi/spec
k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/kubectl/cmd/convert
k8s.io/cli-runtime/pkg/resource
sigs.k8s.io/kustomize/api/krusty
sigs.k8s.io/kustomize/kyaml/openapi
github.com/go-openapi/spec
```

Not sure if that's something we want to change in the future (https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/kustomize/blob/f93cee94404bf0b60ff82785be9ff2af9797463f/kyaml/openapi/openapi.go#L14).

github.com/go-openapi/spec
# github.com/go-openapi/spec => github.com/go-openapi/spec v0.19.5
# github.com/go-openapi/strfmt => github.com/go-openapi/strfmt v0.19.5

comments.body: Where does this come from?  Where are the vendor'ed files?

As mentioned above, `github.com/godbus/dbus/v5` is already vendored because it's used by a transitive dependency. The files are already in vendor: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/tree/master/vendor/github.com/godbus/dbus/v5

The `#explicit` change was added as part of doing

```
$ hack/pin-dependency.sh github.com/godbus/dbus/v5 v5.0.3
$ hack/update-vendor.sh
```

I think it's added to signify this is now explicit direct dependency vs a transitive dependency.

# github.com/godbus/dbus/v5 v5.0.3 => github.com/godbus/dbus/v5 v5.0.3
## explicit
github.com/godbus/dbus/v5
# github.com/godbus/dbus/v5 => github.com/godbus/dbus/v5 v5.0.3

comments.body: what is the diff in this file about?
`go mod vendor` writes more things to this file when the go.mod file indicates go1.14 is in use
we are using 1.14 in CI etc. though right? won't this just get written back by the next person?
it is based on the go directive in the go.mod file, not the go version used
I tend to assume that presubmits will catch incompatibilities with CI (e.g. pull-kubernetes-verify in this case). :crossed_fingers:

comments.body: Oh maybe it's because nothing in Kubernetes is using it yet? We may have to remove the line, I think it is causing the latest dependencies run to fail
I agree, we can remove this for now. I am trying to understand 'go vendor' and k/k tooling on how it formats this file. I worry about this when we enable new repo.

This commented line is required for verify-vendor to be happy. We have more work in the subsequent PRs to remove utils/mount completely from code and I will address further changes to vendor/modules then.
We can't actually get rid of it yet, right?  I still see one dep on it (vendor/github.com/go-openapi/jsonreference/reference.go).  Should we port this same change to go-openapi ?

looks like it asks for a more demanding normalization from the library:
https://github.com/go-openapi/jsonreference/blob/master/reference.go#L117

https://github.com/PuerkitoBio/purell/blob/master/README.md

> FlagsSafe NormalizationFlags = FlagLowercaseHost | FlagLowercaseScheme | FlagUppercaseEscapes | FlagDecodeUnnecessaryEscapes | FlagEncodeNecessaryEscapes | FlagRemoveDefaultPort | FlagRemoveEmptyQuerySeparator

so i don't think the replacement function in this PR is sufficient, as it only handles the duplicate slashes.
